content.title: Neurogenic Thoracic Outlet Syndrome
content.description: Compression of the brachial plexus at the thoracic outlet causing upper extremity pain, paresthesias, and weakness. Most common TOS variant (>90% of cases).

subtypes.true_ntos: Objective neurologic findings, EMG abnormalities, often C8-T1 distribution (Gilliatt-Sumner hand)
subtypes.disputed_ntos: Symptoms without objective findings, controversial diagnosis

content.pathophysiology: Compression between anterior and middle scalene muscles, or between clavicle and first rib. Associated with trauma, repetitive motion, poor posture.
clinical_presentation: Pain and paresthesias in ulnar nerve distribution

provocative_tests.Adson_test: Radial pulse change with head rotation/inspiration

treatment.indications: Failed PT, objective findings, intractable symptoms

primary_sources: Society for Vascular Surgery Guidelines on TOS
